result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief (includes 14CM1635, filed in 14CF814)

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:22 am 
INCLUDES 14CM1635 AND 14CF814. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person with Atty Suzanne O'Neill.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to:
In 14CM1635: Ct. 1 (Battery/DA/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF814: Ct. 1 (Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense)/Repeater/PTAC)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Possession of Controlled Substance/Repeater/PTAC)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CM1635: Ct. 2 (Criminal Damage to Property/DA/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                       : Ct. 3 (DC/DA/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS ON BOTH COUNTS: SAFE program; AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by by the dept; absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; pay restitution of $170 to K.H.; payment of court costs including 2 DA surcharges. 
                                                                          - CONDITION ON CT. 2 ONLY: 30 days MCJ imposed and STAYED for rule violations and only to be used if authorized by the court. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 
Adj: 10:37 am

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:07 am 
INCLUDES 14CF814 AND 14CM1635. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person with Atty Suzanne O'Neill. 
State notes parties have reached an agreement and that the state needs time to confer. COURT advises parties to set plea hearing before trial date of 12/3/2014.
Bond Continues. 
Adj: 10:08 am

records.addlTxt: Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 within 1 business day of release - Day Report Program.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs except if prescribed to defendant.  No contact with co-defendant(s):  K.C.   Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
